title: Rangers re-sign Padilla, Matthews Jr.
subtitle: Rangers re-sign Padilla, Matthews Jr.
body: DALLAS -- The Rangers announced on Friday night that they had avoided arbitration hearings with outfielder Gary Matthews Jr. and pitcher Vicente Padilla by agreeing on one-year contracts.  The Rangers also agreed to a Minor League deal with reliever Antonio Alfonseca, who has 121 career saves. The move is pending a physical.  Padilla agreed to a $4.4 million salary while Matthews agreed to $2.4 million. T.R. Sullivan is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: T.R. Sullivan
